sen.j: 台座とは、仏像や肖像彫刻などを安置する台。
sen.e: Pedestal is the table to put Buddha statue or image sculpture.
The pedestal is the table on which to place a Buddha statue or an image sculpture.
The pedestal is the table on which to place a Buddha statue or an image sculpture.

sen.j: 特に仏像においては、仏を神聖化するために種々の形式がある。
sen.e: Especially for Buddha statue, there are many style of pedestal to make the Buddha holly.
Particularly for a Buddha statue, there are many styles of pedestals used to make the Buddha holy.
Particularly for a Buddha statue, there are many styles of pedestals used to make the Buddha holy.

sen.j: 以下は、仏像の台座について述べる。
sen.e: The following is the details of pedestal for Buddha stature.
The following are the details of the pedestals for Buddha statues.
The following are the details of the pedestals for Buddha statues.

sen.j: 種類
sen.e: Types
Types
Types

sen.j: 蓮華座（れんげざ）
sen.e: Rengeza, padmasana, Lotus base
Rengeza, padmasana, lotus base
Rengeza (padmasana, lotus base)

sen.j: ハスの花をかたどったもの。
sen.e: It has the shape of lotus flower.
It has the shape of a lotus flower.
It has the shape of a lotus flower.

sen.j: 如来や菩薩が最も多く用いる。
sen.e: It is most used for Nyorai and Bosatsu.
It is mostly used for Nyorai and Bosatsu.
It is mostly used for Nyorai and Bosatsu.

sen.j: その他では愛染明王などの明王の一部を除いて蓮華座に乗る例は少ない。
sen.e: There is no other example of Rengeza being used for others except for some Myoo such as Aizen Myoo.
There is no other example of Rengeza being used for others, except for certain Myoo such as Aizen Myoo.
There is no other example of Rengeza being used for others, except for certain Myoo such as Aizen Myoo (Ragaraja).

sen.j: 上等なものには、下部に華蔓が付く。
sen.e: The fine Rengeza has flower of vine on the bottom.
The fine Rengeza has a flowery vine on the bottom.
The fine Rengeza has a flowery vine on the bottom.

sen.j: 須弥座（しゅみざ）
sen.e: Shumiza
Shumiza
Shumiza

sen.j: 須弥山をかたどった形。
sen.e: It has the shape of Sumeru. (in Buddhism - said to be the highest mountain rising in the center of the world)
It has the shape of Sumeru (which, in Buddhism, is said to be the highest mountain, rising at the center of the world).
It has the shape of Mt. Sumeru (in Buddhism - said to be the highest mountain rising in the center of the world).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 如来に用いられる。
sen.e: It is used for Nyorai.
It is used for Nyorai.
It is used for Nyorai.

sen.j: 雲座（うんざ）
sen.e: Unza
Unza
Unza

sen.j: 雲を装飾化したかたち。
sen.e: It has shape of decorated clouds.
It has the shape of stylized clouds.
It has the shape of stylized clouds.

sen.j: 飛天像や阿弥陀如来に見られる。
sen.e: It is seen with Hitenzp stature (a type of angel in Buddhism culture) or Amida Nyorai. (Amitabha Tathagata)
It is seen with the stature of Hitenzo (a type of angel in Buddhist culture) or Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata).
It is seen with the statues of Hiten (a type of angel in Buddhist culture) or Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata).

sen.j: 宣字座（せんじざ）
sen.e: Senjiza
Senjiza
Senjiza

sen.j: 箱型の台座。
sen.e: The pedestal has the shape of box.
The pedestal has a box-like shape.
The pedestal has a box-like shape.

sen.j: 形が「宣」の字に似ていることから。
sen.e: It is called Senjiza as the shape looks like the character of Sen, '宣'.
It is called Senjiza, because the shape resembles the character "Sen (宣).
It is called Senjiza, because the shape resembles the character 'Sen' (宣).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 如来に用いられる。
sen.e: It is used for Nyorai.
It is used for Nyorai.
It is used for Nyorai.

sen.j: 裳懸座（もかけざ）
sen.e: Mokakeza
Mokakeza
Mokakeza

sen.j: 坐像の裳裾が台座にかかり、垂れ下がっているかたち。
sen.e: It has the shape of the train of the seated statue coming down to the pedestal.
It has the shape of the train of the seated statue flowing down to the pedestal.
It has the shape of the train of the seated statue flowing down to the pedestal.

sen.j: 法隆寺金堂の釈迦三尊像の台座が有名。
sen.e: This Mokakeza is famous for Shaka Sanzon zo (the statues of Shakyamuni triads) of Kondo (the Golden Pavillion) of the Horyu-ji Temple.
This Mokakeza is famous for Shaka Sanzon zo (the statues of Shakyamuni triads) of Kondo (the Golden Pavillion) of the Horyu-ji Temple.
This Mokakeza is famous for the statues of Shakyamuni triads of Kondo (the Golden Pavilion) of the Horyu-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 蓮華座に裳を垂らす例は少ないが、岩手中尊寺の一字金輪坐像に見られる。
sen.e: It is also seen with 一字金輪坐像 of Iwate Chuson-ji Temple, although there is not many examples of train coming down on Rengeza.
sen.cmt: 岩手中尊寺, 一字金輪坐像→読み方、定訳不明
sen.e: It is also seen with 一字金輪坐像 of Iwate Chuson-ji Temple, although there aren't many examples of trains flowing down on Rengeza.

It is also seen with the seated statue of Ichiji Kinrin (the principal Buddha of the "Court of the Perfected") of Iwate Chuson-ji Temple, although there aren't many examples of trains flowing down on Rengeza.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 楊座（とうざ）
sen.e: Toza
Toza
Toza

sen.j: 裳懸座の変型。
sen.e: It has the arranged shape of Mokakeza.
It has the arranged shape of Mokakeza.
It has the arranged shape of Mokakeza.

sen.j: 丸椅子のようなかたち。
sen.e: It has the shape of round chair.
It has the shape of a circular chair.
It has the shape of a circular chair.

sen.j: 中宮寺の弥勒菩薩像が有名。
sen.e: Toza is famous for statue of Maitreya of Chugu-ji Temple.
Toza is famous for its statue of Maitreya, of Chugu-ji Temple.
Toza is famous for its statue of Maitreya, of Chugu-ji Temple.

sen.j: 岩座（いわざ）
sen.e: Iwaza
Iwaza
Iwaza

sen.j: 岩をかたどったもの。
sen.e: It has the shape of rocks.
Its shape resembles rocks.
Its shape resembles rocks.

sen.j: 十二神将などの天部や明王像に一般的に用いられる。
sen.e: It is generally used for gods of the heavens such as Juni Shinsho (the twelve protective deities) or Myoo-zo.
It is generally used for gods of the heavens, such as Juni Shinsho (the 12 protective deities) or Myoo-zo.
It is generally used for gods of the heavens, such as Juni Shinsho (the 12 protective deities) or Myoo-zo.

sen.j: 四天王や毘沙門天像は、岩座の上で邪鬼を踏み下ろしているのが通例。
sen.e: The well known Iwaza is Shitenno (four guardian kings) and Bishamon-ten-zo (statue of Bishamon-ten (Vaisravana)) step on malicious ogres standing on top of Iwaza.
The well-known Iwaza is Shitenno (four guardian kings) and Bishamon-ten-zo (statue of Bishamon-ten (Vaisravana)) step on malicious ogres that stand on top of Iwaza.
The well-known Iwaza is the statues of Shitenno (four guardian kings) and Bishamon-ten (Vaisravana) step on malicious ogres that stand on top of Iwaza.

sen.j: 瑟々座（しつしつざ）
sen.e: Shitsushitsuza
Shitsushitsuza
Shitsushitsuza

sen.j: 岩座の一種。
sen.e: A type of Iwaza
A type of Iwaza
A type of Iwaza.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: 角材を井桁状に組んだような形状。
sen.e: It has the shape of square shape logs put together in a double cross shape.
It has the shape of squared logs put together in a double-cross formation.
It has the shape of squared logs put together in a double-cross formation.

sen.j: 不動明王像のみに使用。
sen.e: Shitsushitsuza ia only used for Fudo Myoo zo.
Shitsushitsuza ia only used for Fudo Myoo zo.
Shitsushitsuza is only used for the statue of Fudo Myoo (Acala, one of the Five Wisdom Kings).
sen.cmt: スペルなど変えました。

sen.j: 荷葉座（かしょうざ）
sen.e: Kashoza
Kashoza
Kashoza

sen.j: 蓮の葉をかたどったもの。
sen.e: It has the shape of lotus leaves.
It has the shape of lotus leaves.
It has the shape of lotus leaves.

sen.j: 吉祥天像に用いられる。
sen.e: It is used for the Statue of Kisshoten.
It is used for the statue of Kisshoten.
It is used for the statue of Kisshoten.

sen.j: 禽獣座（きんじゅうざ）
sen.e: Kinjuza
Kinjuza
Kinjuza

sen.j: 普賢菩薩像の象、文殊菩薩像の獅子、大威徳明王像の牛、孔雀明王像のクジャクなどがそれに当たる。
sen.e: It is used for Fugen bosatsu zo (statue of Fugen bosatsu (Samantabhadra Bodhisattva)), Shishi (Chinese lion) of Monju Bosatsuzo, cow statue of Daiitoku Myoo, peacock of Kujaku Myoo-zo. (a figure of Kujaku Myoo (whose name means Peacock King, became a god with the power to stop the effect of poisons))

It's used for Fugen bosatsu zo (statue of Fugen bosatsu (Samantabhadra Bodhisattva)), Shishi (Chinese lion) of Monju Bosatsuzo, the cow statue of Daiitoku Myoo, the peacock of Kujaku Myoo-zo (a figure of Kujaku Myoo (whose name means Peacock King, became a god with the power to neutralize poisons)).

It's used for the elephant of the statue of Fugen bosatsu (Samantabhadra Bodhisattva), Shishi (Chinese lion) of the statue of Monju Bosatsu (Manjusri), the cow of the statue of Daiitoku Myoo (the Wisdom King of Great Awe-inspiring Power), the peacock of the statue of Kujaku Myoo (whose name means Peacock King, became a god with the power to neutralize poisons).

sen.j: 尊像によって定まっている。
sen.e: It is decided by the statue of a noble character.
It is decided by the statue of a noble character.
It is decided by the statue of a noble character.

sen.j: 慣用句
sen.e: An idiom
An idiom
Idioms

sen.j: 台座後光を仕舞う
sen.e: To take away Taiza and halo from the Buddhist statue.
To take away Taiza and the halo from the Buddhist statue
To take away the pedestal and the halo from the Buddhist statue.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 慣用句。
sen.e: An idiom
An idiom
An idiom.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: （仏像から台座と後光（＝光背）とを取り去ると威厳がなくなることから）面目・地位を失うこと。
sen.e: One Taiza and halo is taken away from Buddhist statue, it will lose its dignity, so the idiom means to lose one's face or position.
When Taiza and the halo are taken away from the Buddhist statue, it will lose its dignity, so the idiom means to lose one's face or position.
When the pedestal and the halo are taken away from the Buddhist statue, it will lose its dignity, so the idiom means to lose one's face or position.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 転じて生命を失うこと。
sen.e: Later on the meaning was changed to lose life.
Eventually, meaning was changed to mean losing one's life.
Eventually, meaning was changed to mean losing one's life.

sen.j: 台座の別れ
sen.e: The farewell of Taiza
The farewell of Taiza
The farewell of pedestal
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 慣用句。
sen.e: An idiom
An idiom
An idiom.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: （人間の胴体を台座にたとえて）首が胴を離れること。
sen.e: (In this case Taiza was considered as upper part of human body) it means neck (head) comes off the upper part of the body.
(In this case Taiza was considered as the upper part of the human body), meaning the neck (head) is separated from the upper part of the body.
(In this case the pedestal was considered as the upper part of the human body), meaning the neck (head) is separated from the upper part of the body.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 首を斬られて死ぬこと。
sen.e: To die after being cut someone's head.
To die after having the head cut off
To die after having the head cut off.
sen.cmt: ピリオド補足しました。

sen.j: 「笠の台の生き別れ」ともいう。
sen.e: It is also called 'the farewell (death) on the kasa (the top part of the gravestone) table.'
It is also called 'the farewell (death) on the kasa (the top part of the gravestone) table.'
It is also called 'the farewell (death) on the kasa (the top part of the gravestone) table.'

sen.j: （ただし「笠」は墓石の笠石のこと）
sen.e: (however 'Kasa' means the top part of the gravestone)
(However, 'Kasa' means the top part of the gravestone.)
(However, 'kasa' means the top part of the gravestone.)
